III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, youth woke up in the middle of the night and
had to use the restroom. He called for staff and knocked on his
door, but nobody let him out to use the restroom. He urinated in
his clothes and still nobody came to let him out, so he changed his
clothes and went back to sleep. On another occasion, youth had
to use the restroom and was not let out of his room. An unknown
staff told him several times that he was going to come get him, but
the staff did not come get him. It is assumed that the staff left.
Eventually another staff member came and let youth out to use
the bathroom. Youth was about to defecate on the floor when that
staff came to help. It is unknown how long he had to wait for
assistance.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 21,
2024. Complainant said Youth A has a history of wetting the bed
and struggles with encopresis at times which may have been a
factor in these incidents.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 22, 2024. Youth A said he woke up in the middle of the
night and needed to urinate so knocked two different times on his
door and no staff responded. He urinated in his clothing, changed
his clothes and went back to bed. Youth A said he does not
remember when it happened, if it was a school night, or what staff
was working the night it occurred. Youth A said a few weeks ago
he got up for the day by Staff 1 and got ready for school and was
placed back in his bedroom by Staff 1. Youth A said he needed to
use the restroom so he began to knock on the door and Staff 2
came and let him out to use the bathroom. Youth A said he
believes he was in his room for less than ten minutes. Youth A
said he is locked in his bedroom every night and if he asks to
spend time alone in his room, but no other time throughout the
day. Youth A said these are the only incidents of him needing to
use the bathroom while locked in his bedroom.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
February 22, 2024. Youth B said he is locked in his bedroom at
night and no other time throughout the day. Youth B said when he
2

is in his room and needs to be let out to use the bathroom he
knocks, and staff allows him out. Youth B denied ever having a
time when he was not allowed out to use the bathroom. Youth B
said a few weeks ago Staff 1 got all the youth out of rooms and
ready for the day and then put them back in their bedrooms for a
short time to go talk to the other staff and then the “day staff” let
them out of their rooms. Youth B was not able to recall how long
he was in his room or which staff got him back out of his room.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on March 5, 2024. Staff 1
said he was previously employed at Osceola Youth Center and his
last day was February 12, 2024. Staff 1 said he worked third shift
and was supposed to work from 11pm until 7am, noting that he
never got out on time and was frequently made to stay over for an
hour or more to wait for the next shift. Staff 1 said Staff 2 was in
charge of the schedule and would not have staff schedule or have
them coming into work after 7am. Staff 1 said the morning of
February 12, 2024, he received a text message at 7:30am from
Staff 2, asking him to bring items from detention to the shelter unit.
Staff 1 said he put the youth in their rooms and completed the task
and when he was in the shelter unit it was decided by Staff 3 that
Staff 1 would leave, and Staff 3 would remain at the facility until
the first shift staff arrived. Staff 1 said he then clocked out and left
for the day. Staff 1 said staff for first shift would have a “shift brief”
each morning but he never locked the youth in their rooms for this
shift brief and he would remain on the unit until another staff
arrived. Staff 1 noted he only worked Friday, Saturday and Sunday
nights and so was unaware if things were different on weekday
shifts. Staff 1 said Youth A never had a situation where he was
locked in his room and not allowed out to use the bathroom on
any of his shifts. Staff 1 said he was made aware that Youth A
does wet the bed however he said that never occurred on any of
his shifts.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face on February 27, 2024.
Staff 2 said she arrived on February 12, 2024, and saw Staff 1
getting into his car at 7:41am. Staff 2 said when she entered the
building she was checking the schedule and realized that Staff 1
was supposed to stay over. She went into the detention hallway at
7:45am and saw the youth were in their rooms, heard Youth A
knocking to get out and use the bathroom, and let all the youth out
to finish getting ready for the day. Staff 2 said Staff 1 had told
another staff he needed to leave at 7:30am that day, so he left
without supervisor notification or permission. Staff 2 said youth
typically are awoken at 6:45am and begin to get ready for the day.
Staff 2 said at times the youth are placed back in their rooms for
3

shift change and other times the staff just overlap on the unit
quickly and the youth are never put back in their bedrooms.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on March 15, 2024. Staff
3 said he was working third shift on the shelter unit on February
12, 2024. Staff 3 said Staff 1 did come over to the shelter unit in
the morning however there was not a conversation about who was
going to stay or leave. Staff 3 said Staff 1 left the shelter unit and
after a few minutes he heard some knocking on the detention unit
so went to check and see what was happening. Staff 2 was on the
unit letting the youth out of their rooms and asked him to stay until
the first shift staff arrived, which he did. Staff 3 said there is a “shift
briefing” between each shift which normally takes place between
the staff on the unit.
Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
7, 2024. Director said the program does a shift briefing between
every shift and attempts to complete the briefing without locking
the detention youth in their bedrooms. Director said placing the
detention youth in their bedrooms for shift change is a tool staff
are aware of, but it is not consistently used or needed depending
on the day.
Video Review:
Video footage of February 12, 2024, detention hallway was
reviewed on February 27, 2024. Staff 1 has the youth out of
rooms getting ready for the day at 6:59am. Staff 1 is seen putting
the youth back in their rooms at 7:40am and completing a check.
Staff 3 is then seen in the hallway with all of the youth at 7:47am.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was one disciplinary action
dated February 5, 2024, for being disrespectful to
administration showing a lack of professionalism. Staff 1
was trained on Youth Supervision, Movement, and Checks
on October 24, 2023.
• Youth Opportunity Youth Supervision, Movement and
Checks Policy was reviewed. The policy outlines the
expectations for staff supervision of youth including
sleeping hours and the requirement to check the youth “at
least every ten minutes”.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Program Statement. The
staff followed the facility guidelines and procedures to check on
youth not to exceed ten-minute intervals. The youth was placed in
his room for a shift change which is allowed per the rules and was
4

checked on prior to the ten-minute expectation and allowed out of
his room to use the bathroom. There is no evidence that staff did
not allow the youth out of his room to use the bathroom.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
